In the past, noble families entrusted their vault keys to a _____. They passed the _____ down through the generations, taking good care of it.
Once it absorbs a key’s metal ions, it discards the key without a second thought. However, it will hang on to keys it favors for decades.
_____ sucks in metal ions with the horn topping its head. It seems this Pokémon loves keys so much that its head needed to look like one, too.
This Pokémon is constantly collecting keys. Entrust a _____ with important keys, and the Pokémon will protect them no matter what.
Long ago it lived in mines, but once the minerals that make up its diet became scarcer, _____ began appearing in human settlements.
Although it’s unclear why it collects keys, giving it a key makes _____ very happy. However, it apparently only likes master keys.
It inserts its horn into chinks in metal, absorbing metal ions. For some reason, it collects keys.
This even-tempered Pokémon has a habit of collecting keys. It will sneak into people’s homes to steal their keys.
It never lets go of a key that it likes, so people give it the keys to vaults and safes as a way to prevent crime.
These key collectors threaten any attackers by fiercely jingling their keys at them.
